intro: Siphocampylus libanensis, commonly known as the Lebanon siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
